intro: Nassauvia cordifolia, commonly known as heartleaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Nassauvia cordifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
